suncertify.db.domain
Class DataRecord

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.db.domain.DataRecord

public final class DataRecord
extends java.lang.Object

Represents a data record as it appears in the data file.

Besides the attributes of a data record (name, location, specialities, size, rate, owner), instances of DataRecord contain the number of the record in the data file and its state (i.e. valid or deleted).

This class is basically a wrapper for a String array representing a data record. It allows to easily convert from one representation of a data record to another and provides more meaningful access methods (e.g. recordObject.getLocation() instead of recordArray[2], or recordObject.isBooked() instead of recordArray[5] != null).

Field Detail

NO_NUMBER_ASSIGNED

public static final long NO_NUMBER_ASSIGNED
Constant value for the record number attribute signifying that this record has not yet been assigned a number.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

OWNER_ID

public static final java.lang.String OWNER_ID
Constant value used as value for owner field.

As specified, the system does not interact with these numbers, rather it simply records them. In the context of the application we only care, if the owner field has a value or not. We don't inspect the value or use it in any way, other than detect if it is set at all.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Constructor Detail

DataRecord

public DataRecord(long recNo,
                  DataRecordState state,
                  java.lang.String name,
                  java.lang.String location,
                  java.lang.String specialties,
                  java.lang.String size,
                  java.lang.String rate,
                  java.lang.String owner)
Creates a new DataRecord with the specified attribute values.

Trailing whitespace is deleted from all specified parameters.

Parameters:
state - State of the DataRecord in the db file
name - name of the subcontractor
location - locality in which this contractor works
specialties - Comma separated list of types of work this contractor can perform
size - number of workers available
rate - Charge per hour for the subcontractor
owner - ID value (an 8 digit number) of the customer

DataRecord

public DataRecord(long recNo,
                  DataRecordState state,
                  java.lang.String[] recordData)
Creates a new data record with the specified number, state and attribute values.

This constructor allows to directly use a String array parameter to build the DataRecord wrapper from.

Trailing whitespace is deleted from all specified parameters.

Parameters:
recNo - number of the record
state - state of the record
recordData - attribute values

DataRecord

public DataRecord(long recNo,
                  java.lang.String[] recordData)
Creates a new data record object with the specified number and attribute values.

The state is assumed to be valid.

Parameters:
recNo - number of the record
recordData - attribute values

DataRecord

public DataRecord(java.lang.String[] recordData)
Creates a new data record with the specified attribute values.

The record number is set to a special value, signifying that the number is not assigned yet. The record state is assumed to be valid

Parameters:
recordData - attribute values
